title: U.N. Official Heads to Ukrainian Nuclear Plant as Safety Fears Grow
description: The official met with President Volodymyr Zelensky to discuss the Zaporizhzhia plant, amid worries that a Ukrainian offensive could raise the already-high risk of disaster.

title: Netanyahu Delays Bid to Overhaul Israel’s Judiciary as Protests Rage
description: The Israeli prime minister called for dialogue as civil unrest and work stoppages reached a crisis point, grinding the country to a halt.

title: After Doling Out Huge Loans, China Is Now Bailing Out Countries
description: Beijing is emerging as a new heavyweight in providing emergency funds to debt-ridden countries, catching up to the I.M.F. as a lender of last resort.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Netanyahu Shifts Course
description: Also, a Taiwanese ex-president’s trip to China and U.S. diplomacy in Africa.

title: Paul Rusesabagina, ‘Hotel Rwanda’ Dissident, Lands in Qatar
description: His release ended more than two and a half years of captivity, during which he was tried on terrorism charges and sentenced to 25 years in prison.

title: Who Is Itamar Ben-Gvir?
description: The influence of Itamar Ben-Gvir, a rising far-right lawmaker, was underscored when he said he would agree to a delay of the divisive judicial overhaul.

title: Lebanon Backtracks on Delaying Daylight Saving Time After Outrage
description: Two government leaders delayed the time change so Muslims would not have to break their daytime fast an hour later during Ramadan. But after a firestorm ensued, they backtracked.

title: Global Economy May Be in a ‘Lost Decade,’ World Bank Warns
description: Adding to crises like the pandemic, recent stress in the banking system is a new threat to world growth, experts at the organization said.

title: Scotland’s National Party Picks Humza Yousaf to Succeed Sturgeon
description: Humza Yousaf is on course to become the first Muslim to lead a democratic western European nation, and when that happens, he will confront several daunting obstacles.

title: Biden Acts to Restrict U.S. Government Use of Spyware
description: The president signed an executive order seeking to limit deployment of a tool that has been abused by autocracies — and some democracies — to spy on dissidents, human rights activists and journalists.

title: Biden’s Northern Ireland Visit Stirs Concerns About Slighting King Charles
description: President Biden is expected to mark the anniversary of a landmark peace accord, but his timing, and his itinerary, have raised questions about the signal they send to a close ally.

title: Transport Workers Go on Strike in Germany
description: One of the largest public transportation walkouts in decades was intended to give unions leverage as they seek raises to keep pace with rising inflation.

title: Have AI Chatbots Developed Theory of Mind? What We Do and Do Not Know.
description: Some researchers claim that chatbots have developed theory of mind. But is that just our own theory of mind gone wild?

title: Meet the Xi Jinping Loyalist Now Overseeing China’s Economy
description: He Lifeng’s long career in government has spanned the extremes of China’s approach, from the early embrace of small business in the 1980s to today’s tighter state control.

title: Israel’s Judiciary Overhaul Plan: What to Know
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing government contends the Supreme Court has unchecked power, but critics of the proposal say it goes too far.

title: A Republican Spending Problem
description: Will the House be willing to cut programs that benefit G.O.P. voters?

title: Live Updates: Turmoil Engulfs Israel Over Plan to Overhaul Top Court
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition was debating whether to delay judicial changes that have set off civil unrest. Work stoppages spread, with a strike blocking flights from leaving a major airport.

title: Safety Concerns Persist at Ukrainian Nuclear Plant
description: The situation at Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant remains “precarious,” according to the top U.N. nuclear safety official.

title: The World Bank estimated the cost of rebuilding Ukraine at $411 billion. Support is growing to use Russian funds for it.
Restoring a Giant Plane: Ukrainian Resilience or Folly?
description: Ukraine, with far more pressing needs, plans to rebuild the colossal Mriya cargo plane, a symbol of pride that was destroyed last year in a battle for its airfield.

title: Germany Wants More Chip Makers, but They Won’t Come Cheap
description: The global competition to attract semiconductor companies is expected to cost Berlin billions. Some wonder if it’s a good use of money.

title: The Ukrainians hold on with old tanks, but relish the idea of advancing with modern Western battle tanks.
Israeli Government’s Plan to Overhaul the Judiciary Sets Off a Crisis
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing government contends the Supreme Court has unchecked power.

title: Taiwan’s Ex-President, Ma Ying-yeou, Heads to China in a Historic Visit
description: Though his visit is not official, it is nonetheless significant and may offer clues to political calculations on both sides of the increasingly tense Taiwan Strait.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Mass protests in Israel.

title: Kamala Harris Looks to Deepen Relations With Africa Amid China’s Influence
description: In a weeklong trip to Ghana, Tanzania and Zambia, the vice president will face a balancing act as she tries to foster a collaborative U.S. relationship.
